name: absolute
content:
absolute adjective
(VERY GREAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 very great or to the largest degree possible: a man of absolute integrity/discretion I have absolute faith in her judgment. There was no absolute proof of fraud.
B2 [ before noun ] used when expressing a strong opinion: He's an absolute idiot! That's absolute rubbish!
More examplesFewer examplesHis room is an absolute dump!I then realized to my absolute horror, that I had forgotten the present.When you're stuck in traffic, a mobile phone's an absolute life-saver.You won't have any problems with the entrance test - it's an absolute breeze.You've been an absolute gem - I couldn't have managed without your help.
